text: made this channel *public*. Any member in this workspace can see and join it.
Hey all - does this change mean timeline events can only be added, never be updated?
Hi Tim, yes thatâ€™s right - events will be create only, updates will no longer be possible

Ok, thought so, thanks for confirming. Any chance the team consider enhancing v3 to support updates?

We have customers that are using the update capabilities. For example, for a sync with Greenhouse ATS Candidates may apply for multiple jobs. Each unique job application is represented as a timeline event against the contact; as the application is updated in the ATS certain attributes are updated in the HS timeline event (e.g. application status/reason rejected and similar). This works really well, particularly when combined with lists. It will be a messier experience for users if we add multiple of these for each job application to the contact timeline as the updates happen.

Admittedly, in some cases, we could re-engineer to use custom objects however that is not always possible.
Unfortunately the V3 will remain immutable. The immutability unlocks a lot of features in the future that mutability cannot support.

purpose: RE: Removing Timeline API V1 mutability. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/legacy-v1-integration-timeline-api-update>
